channel.title: LinkedOut - Thomas Dion
channel.description: Recent content on LinkedOut - Thomas Dion

item.title: 53,000 Contacts Generated with Python & SQL
item.description:
I’m excited to share a project that generated an additional $150K CAD in revenue for my team! üí∞

The Challenge: Our sales team needed high-quality leads in construction and professional services, but manual prospecting was eating up 20+ hours per week.

The Solution: Built a Python/SQL automation system that: ‚úÖ Generated 53,000 targeted contacts across key industries ‚úÖ Enriched data with company size, revenue estimates, and decision-maker titles ‚úÖ Automated list distribution to account managers ‚úÖ Integrated directly with our CRM pipeline

item.title: Cold Calling in 2025: Still Undefeated
item.description:
Hot take: Cold calling isn’t dead. You’re just doing it wrong. üìû

My Stats at TELUS: ‚Ä¢ 60 calls per day (consistently) ‚Ä¢ 2.4% conversion rate (industry average: 1-2%) ‚Ä¢ 350+ new SMB clients acquired in 13 months ‚Ä¢ $302K ARR generated ‚Ä¢ 95% client retention rate (industry average: 80%)

What’s working in 2025:

1. Research Before the Call I spend 2 minutes researching each prospect. Their website, recent news, pain points. The call is 30 seconds, but the prep wins the deal.

item.title: Product Owner Who Codes: Why I Ship Faster
item.description:
Unpopular opinion: Product Owners should know how to code.

Not because they need to write production code. But because it changes how you think about product development.

My Experience at Datazentrik: ‚Ä¢ Managed 104 weekly sprints ‚Ä¢ Delivered 202 features ‚Ä¢ Designed and implemented the P√©trole Papillons website end-to-end (frontend, API integration, UX) ‚Ä¢ Automated SEO-optimized content creation using generative AI (LLMs, OpenAI)

What Coding Knowledge Gave Me:

1. Better User Stories I wasn’t writing vague requirements. I understood technical constraints and could write actionable acceptance criteria.

item.title: From Wealth Manager to Tech Sales: My Unconventional Path
item.description:
2018: Graduated from Le Wagon (Full-Stack Web Developer) 2021: Became a Wealth Manager at Manulife 2022: Pivoted to Product Owner at a tech startup 2024: Now an Account Manager at TELUS crushing quota

People ask: “Why didn’t you just become a developer?”

Here’s the truth: I found my edge at the intersection of sales, product, and code.

What Wealth Management Taught Me: ‚Ä¢ Cold calling high-net-worth clients ($200k-$400k portfolios) ‚Ä¢ Simplifying complex concepts for non-technical audiences ‚Ä¢ Building trust through consultative selling ‚Ä¢ Portfolio management & risk analysis ‚Ä¢ Acquired $1.3M in AUM in 12 months

item.title: How I Exceeded Quota by 20% (While Others Missed Theirs)
item.description:
13 months at TELUS. $302K ARR. 20% above quota.

Here’s exactly what I did differently:

1. Volume + Quality (Not Volume OR Quality)

Most reps choose one. I refused.

‚Ä¢ 60 calls/day (volume) ‚Ä¢ 2 minutes of research per call (quality) ‚Ä¢ Targeted industries where I had domain knowledge ‚Ä¢ Used Python to prioritize highest-value prospects

2. Upsells Start at “Hello”

I don’t wait 6 months to upsell. I identify expansion opportunities during the first conversation.

item.title: I Automated Content Creation with AI (Here's What Actually Worked)
item.description:
The Project: Automate SEO-optimized content creation using generative AI

The Tools: OpenAI, Claude, Gemini, DeepSeek, Ollama, N8N, LangChain

The Goal: Create high-quality content at scale without sacrificing quality

What Actually Worked:

1. LLMs Aren’t Magic (But They’re Close)

You can’t just prompt “write me a blog post” and expect gold. You need: ‚Ä¢ Context about the brand voice ‚Ä¢ SEO keywords and search intent ‚Ä¢ Content structure/outline ‚Ä¢ Examples of high-performing content

item.title: My Tech Stack as an Account Manager (Yes, Really)
item.description:
People are always surprised when I tell them I use Python, SQL, and cloud services as an Account Manager.

“Isn’t that for developers?”

Nope. It’s for anyone who wants an unfair advantage.

My Sales Tech Stack:

üêç Python ‚Ä¢ Lead generation scripts ‚Ä¢ Data enrichment automation ‚Ä¢ CRM data cleaning ‚Ä¢ Pipeline analytics ‚Ä¢ Email sequence optimization

üóÑÔ∏è SQL ‚Ä¢ Querying customer databases ‚Ä¢ Building custom reports ‚Ä¢ Analyzing conversion patterns ‚Ä¢ Segmenting prospects ‚Ä¢ Performance dashboards
